Package userInterface

Class ShowAppointment

java.lang.Object
userInterface.ShowAppointment
public class ShowAppointment
extends java.lang.Object
This function gets the data of booked appointments from the database and stores it in variables.
Author:
Muhamamd Obaid Ullah , Syed Adil Ehsan , Rao Shahan Naveed

    • pr

      public java.lang.String pr

  • Constructor Details

    • ShowAppointment

      public ShowAppointment()

  • Method Details

    • show_appointment_month

      public void show_appointment_month​(java.lang.String month, java.lang.String year) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Gets month and year as input. Checks each day of the months and finds the appointment of it. Marks them as booked.
      Parameters:
      month - appointments of this month are to be shown.
      year - will be used in getting appointments of the needed month of the year.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - shows error in connection with database and related to database.

    • check_end_time

      public void check_end_time​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String endDay) throws java.sql.SQLException
      This function determines the end time of the appointment and marks it in the hourly view.
      Parameters:
      username - is the profile that is to be checked.
      endDay - last day of the appointment.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - shows error in connection with database and related to database.

    • check_in_the_middle

      public void check_in_the_middle​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String day) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Checks if the selected comes in between the starting date and the ending date of an event
      Parameters:
      username - profile name of the user that is logged in
      day - date that is to be checked
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - shows error in connection with database and related to database

    • show_start_appointment_day

      public void show_start_appointment_day​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String day) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Checks the starting time of an event in the database and compares it with the day to be checked.
      Parameters:
      username - profile id of the user who is logged in
      day - date that is to be checked
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - shows error in connection with database and related to database

    • mark

      public void mark()
      Hours are marked along with there respective priorities for the coloring purposes. Starting and ending hours are given here.

    • mark_fromend

      public void mark_fromend()
      If event starts on a day and carries on to the next day , only the start time of that event will be needed.

      The day will be marked until the end.

    • mark_fromStart

      public void mark_fromStart()
      If event ends on a day , only the end time of that event will be needed.

      The day will be marked from the start to that time.
